The house was extremely clean and we loved the added touches so we could learn about the history of the home. The house is just a short distance from the water and a park, the Civic Center (farmer's market), as well as downtown Holland, with shops and restaurants galore. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend it!

If you're planning on mostly eating out, there is no need to bring anything other than your favorite beverage or snacks; basic condiments, coffee add-ins, etc. have been graciously provided. The house was clean, well-decorated, and comfortable - beds, towels, and sitting room furniture were all well done. I will be coming back and staying here; I look forward to showing and sharing the cottage with my wife at the next opportunity...

The space is generous, the appliances are all full size and new, and the beds are soooo comfortable. We loved being able to store our bikes in the little shed, we took advantage of the patio and enjoyed morning coffee there, and then relaxed in the comfortable big chairs in the living room in the evening. Loved Lynelle's visit to get acquainted on our first day! We LOVED being so close to bike trails and downtown, the not-to-be-missed Farmer's Market (Wednesdays and Saturdays) is just a couple blocks away, Kollen Park is just around the corner, Boatwerks Restaurant is across the street. Honestly, this is the best place ever!!

review_text: We stayed at Lynelle's place in early June. The location can't be beat -- we walked to downtown, the Farmer's Market, and Kollen Park nearly every day of our stay. We had our 10 month old with us and really appreciated how baby proofed the space was. The kitchen was well-stocked with cookware, pots and pans, and utensils, and Lynelle even had some spices, cooking oil, and coffee which is always a very nice touch. My husband and I did have a little trouble with how warm the upstairs room was at night, even with the AC working hard downstairs. We had a little thermometer we brought from home which showed the upstairs as 8 degrees warmer than the downstairs. Lynelle did provide fans which helped a little. Of course it was June in Michigan with the weather in the upper 80s when we were there, so this likely won't be a problem for everyone. Overall we loved our stay and would definitely return.

Group trip
review_text:
Loved the location of this house! It sits in a quiet development with little traffic. You get a small view of the lake from the deck but you can see it. It's ideally located halfway between downtown Holland and the Holland State Park beach - each is about 6 minutes away.
The house was perfect for 3 couples. It has two bedrooms downstairs that share a bathroom and one upstairs with a second bath. We didn't do a lot of cooking with all of the great restaurants nearby but the kitchen and dining areas were fine. We did enjoy the deck. It was a great place for a morning cup of coffee. The furniture was comfortable and with the addition of a dining room chair, there was enough seating for all of us.
I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the Holland area!

The hot tub was frequented every day, and was perfect even in the rain! We absolutely loved snuggling up in the screened in patio, a fire at our feet and a movie playing on the TV. If youâ€™re city folk like us - donâ€™t worry about the outdoor shower, the water never ran cold and it was more than private. It was peaceful and comfortable to shower even well into a dark evening. I echo my husbands words as we packed up - â€œThis is the first Airbnb that Iâ€™m not ready to leave!â€

The cozy screened-in porch provided more space since the bedroom area is quite small. I can't say enough about being able to chill in the hot tub with the campfire blazing a few feet away. We used it at night and in the morning both days. The outhouse wasn't the greatest though it is cute but the outdoor shower was adorable and it was super awesome to be able to shower in nature! It felt private, the water pressure was just right we loved that little area. The pond fountain was cool and necessary to turn on to drown out the highway noise. It's a perfect setting, close to everything. Did I mention the hot tub is amazing? :)

review_text:
My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this cute and comfortable, easy to find place during the Tulip Time festival for our anniversary. The rental was just right as far as space for 2 and being positioned relatively close to festivities.
As a designer of sorts, I appreciated the simple, stylish decor provided. There was also functional furnishings like front entrance hooks for coats, purses and keys and a multilevel coffee table in the living room for our phones, tablets, tea and snacks. In the bedroom, inviting pillows dressed the bed, small lamp lighting gave the space moodiness and floating shelves optimized the space well.
We also personally utilized the comfy couch one night to watch some shows, stove and fridge for heating up water and storing a few picnic items as well as the bathroom shower in the morning. Water was hot, towels were fresh and fluffy.
John and Ami were flexible and stayed in good communication leading up to and through our visit. Would recommend to others :)

If youâ€™re just escaping the daily grind, there are plenty of movies and books to sit and chill with. Todd and Mary have taken all the precautions for this COVID era, and we felt very safe in our stay. Stayed with kids
review_text:
Kathy's Airbnb is a remarkable embodiment of cleanliness, comfort, and homeliness. The meticulous attention to cleanliness is evident in every corner of the accommodation, with pristine linens, spotless surfaces, and an overall aura of impeccable hygiene.
What truly sets Kathy's Airbnb apart, however, is the undeniable feeling of being at home. The personal touches that adorn the space, from family photographs, beautiful framed quotes, carefully curated decor, lend a unique and inviting character to the accommodation. Guests are welcomed with open arms, and Kathy's Airbnb becomes not just a place to stay but a genuine home away from home.
Kathy, Judy, and Jim go above and beyond the call of duty when it comes to hospitality. Their warmth and kindness are unparalleled.
Staying at Kathy's is not merely a temporary stay; it is an unforgettable journey into the heart of warmth, comfort, and genuine human connection.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Kathy and Jim, and their daughter, Jodi were wonderful hosts, and even better people! They were kind, generous and very helpful. The lodgings were very comfortable; good mattress, nice bathroom and shower, and very nice kitchenette with fridge, microwave and coffeemaker. Kathy provided everything needed for breakfast; milk, orange juice, yogurt, cold cereals and delicious homemade granola! There was also homemade chocolate chip cookies, windmill cookies, and microwave popcorn. The backyard retreat and lanai were also accessible to my sister and I as guests. The gardens out back were beautiful for the eyes as well as for the soul. Kathy and Jim allowed us to use their garage for our bikes, and Jim was so kind to put our bikes back on our bike rack! This was such a wonderful experience, that I almost have my husband talked in to going up for a few days in the fall. Holland was such a pleasant town and I would like him to experience some of it.

review_text:
We cannot say enough about hosts Kathy, Jim and Jodi!! What a warm and gracious welcoming family! The private lower level of their lovely home was very clean, comfortable and inviting, and the bed quite comfortable. Kathy's delicious homemade cookies and granola, yogurt, coffee, cereal, milk and juice made for an unexpected and gratifying breakfast!
Kathy's place has an incredibly GORGEOUS backyard, including a patio and table where you may sit and relax, taking in all the beauty with a cup of coffee or a glass of your wine, and if you are lucky they may join you! Their suggestions for things to do on our Michigan coast trip, even beyond Holland, were amazing and many ended up being some of our favorite destinations! A special thanks to Jim for sharing his wonderful travel knowledge and ideas with us, for which we are grateful!
We highly recommend Kathy's place, and hope to treat ourselves to a return visit there in the future! Thanks for the memories!

I have never dared to book a basement spaceâ€¦ but I completely forgot it was a basement space as it feels like a homey but complete hotel studio space. Of course, there is some noise from upstairs, but the bedroom is very quiet.
The hosts keep the house and space cozy, but space heaters are available and the shower is warm and greatâ€¦ man a warm shower that has great water pressure cannot be undervalued!!
Proximity to Lake Michigan, the beaches, the dunes, the lighthouses, SNOW, rivers, trails, and even Chicago is brilliantâ€¦ soo many things to do in every direction. I was able to join an exhilarating winter hike on the beach, just 15 minutes or so away.

Thank you, and look forward to next visit!!

Kathy's place in Holland is a perfect example of why we prefer airbnb to hotels. It's a beautiful house in a very nice neighborhood - great for walks and a short drive to restaurants and other businesses.
The lodging is a very spacious basement suite - one of us could be working in the living room without disturbing the other in the bedroom. There is not a private entrance, but Jim and Kathy and Jodi are happy to deal with who you are (sociable or not :-)).
We were very impressed with their generosity - we arrived to homemade cookies, milk and juice, bottled water, and a selection of cereals. Holland's water is also perfectly good for drinking.
We'd definitely want to stay at Kathy's place again!

review_text: What a treasure! I harness AirBnB regularly but itâ€™s less often that I will opt for a â€œprivate roomâ€ and only do so after reading the reviews. Iâ€™m so glad I stayed at Kathyâ€™s! While I was only booked for one night, Kathy and her family made sure that I had everything that I needed (and more!) and honored my scheduling/communication needs. She generously left me cookies, milk, OJ, and a selection of yogurts. This listing is for a basement apartment which includes a living room with a couch, coffee and end tables, three arm chairs, a work desk, and a small dining table with two chairs. There is a kitchenette with a nice sink, small countertop fridge and microwave. The bathroom has a sink, toilet, corner shower (hot water!) and ample places to hang wet towels. The bedroom has a queen bed with a metal coil mattress, and extra pillows in the closet where there is also a fan and space heater if needed. There was also a window in the bedroom, and a light on each side of the bed with a small place to set something. Entrance to this unit is from inside their home, either front door or from inside the garage. This is unit is in a partially finished basement with doors to a finished storage area, and keep in mind that West Michigan is humid as itâ€™s close to those gorgeous white sandy beaches! During the day I could hear piano lessons etc, but it was very quiet at night, other than the crickets singing outside. Be sure to plan some time to relax and enjoy their green thumbs because what a garden they have made! I look forward to sitting and enjoying the garden, which backs up to the tree line, the next time I come. Thanks Kathy!

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Kathy, Jim, and Jodi are lovely hosts. Kathy was prompt with communication, flexible, and friendly. The unit was close to everything downtown Holland has to offer. We especially enjoyed the farmers market and Bowerman's Cafe on 8th. We were in town for a three-day event in Holland. Kathy gave us a quick tour upon arrival and then gave our family privacy to unpack. The basement unit was clean and generous in size, and the beds were comfortable. The kitchenette was set up like a hotel with a small table. Plan to meal prep, bring microwaveable meals or eat out. It was good value and much less than area hotels for the same weekend. The best part of our stay was Kathy and Jim's stunning backyard. A true gardener's delight with pebble paths and stunning flowers. June was the perfect time to visit! Per previous reviews, we brought a cozy sweatshirt and an extra blanket as the basement runs a bit cool. It was a good temperature for sleeping. We truly enjoyed our weekend and will book again in the future.

The apartment is well-stocked with anything you could need during your stay, and Rob was available to lend us a stockpot within a few minutes when we needed one for dinner on our last night.
The apartment/house is nice and quiet all day and the WiFi was speedy, making it easy for me to work remotely a few days during our stay.
The historic neighborhood + downtown Holland was delightful to explore, lots of yummy eats and cute shops truly just a few minutes on foot away.
Cannot recommend this enough; weâ€™ll absolutely stay again if weâ€™re ever back in Holland!

Visiting in late August and early September would have been a lovely time to have my windows open, but I could not for fear of visiting insects. The unit does have two window air conditioning units that kept me perfectly comfortable. But if you prefer fresh air, this will be an issue.

It felt like I was walking into a storybook walking up onto the wrap-around porch and into the house up to the attic. The steps up to the 2nd floor are standard and the steps to the attic are just a little steeper than your standard steps. Not a problem for our family, but just to note. The apartment is lofty, bright, and airy. It feels like an artists loft with a kitchen, open living space (great for gathering), and 2 bedrooms. Clean, well-appointed, and perfect location make this a great option in Holland. Rob was just a great host and was quick to respond to any questions. The charm and feeling like a character in a book was a bonus!
